abstracts.cdata!:
The project is rated satisfactory,
            sustainability is likely, and both the Bank, and the
            Borrower's performances were satisfactory. The key
            lessons reinforce the notion that close cooperation with the
            potential beneficiaries of public sector investments in
            irrigation infrastructure, is advantageous, for it develops
            not only their involvement, but the sense of ownership,
            particularly essential when cost recovery is a requirement,
            and also, because of its significant contributions to
            on-farm development. Close attention should be given to
            water usage, so as to achieve an efficient operational, and
            infrastructure maintenance, for, its institutional
            development, when adequately planned, and implemented pays
            good dividends. Since decentralization facilitates
            farmers' participation in demand-driven projects, a
            close working relationship with sub-national governments
            becomes essential, even if these are not the main source of
            investment funding. Careful technical quality of
            pre-investment analysis should be emphasized, for, projects
            such as this one, require the farmers' commitment as of
            the earliest stages, and, accurate cost estimates are
            needed, to foster adequate budget planning. Unfortunately,
            budget fragmentation, hindered budgetary allocation for
            individual sub-components, and activities.

abstracts.cdata!:
The project aims to improve the
            operation and efficiency of existing and future irrigation
            schemes and enhance the welfare of small farmers.  It will
            also improve the allocation and sustainability of
            investments and strengthen the capacity of user groups and
            small farmers to exploit better irrigated agriculture.  The
            project will:  (a) invest in rehabilitation and
            modernization of existing irrigation schemes and in the
            construction of new small and medium-size schemes; (b)
            support small farmers in agricultural development to
            complement irrigation investment; and (c) regularize water
            titles and strengthen the managerial capacity of user groups.
